MEDICAL RECORDS & RECOMMENDATIONS:
--------------------------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Try to follow an anti inflammatory Mediterranean style diet rich in colourful vegetables, healthy fats such as olives, avocado, olive oil, nuts and seeds, good quality protein and fatty fish. Try to limit refined carbohydrates such as bread, pasta, rice, pastries etc and eliminate sugar.
Comment Key: ChronicMedicationList
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.
Comment Key: ChronicMedicationList
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Try to reduce your waist circumference by sticking to a healthy diet, decreasing stress and continuing with your exercise. If you are not managing consider seeing a dietician and possibly your gynae as you may be entering perimenopause.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.

Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.

Overview Notes: Ideal waist circumference for women falls below 80 cm, above 80 cm increases your risk of chronic diseases. Father has had a stent inserted in his heart and mother is hypertensive.
Comment Key: ChronicMedicationList
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.
Comment Key: ChronicMedicationList
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Try to reduce your waist circumference by sticking to a healthy diet, decreasing stress and continuing with your exercise. If you are not managing consider seeing a dietician and possibly your gynae as you may be entering perimenopause.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Ideal waist circumference for women falls below 80 cm, above 80 cm increases your risk of chronic diseases. Father has had a stent inserted in his heart and mother is hypertensive.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: None
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Men's Health Recommendations:

Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.

Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Try to reduce your waist circumference by sticking to a healthy diet, decreasing stress and continuing with your exercise. If you are not managing consider seeing a dietician and possibly your gynae as you may be entering perimenopause.

Overview Notes: Try to reduce your waist circumference by sticking to a healthy diet, decreasing stress and continuing with your exercise. If you are not managing consider seeing a dietician and possibly your gynae as you may be entering perimenopause.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Overview Notes: Try to reduce your waist circumference by sticking to a healthy diet, decreasing stress and continuing with your exercise. If you are not managing consider seeing a dietician and possibly your gynae as you may be entering perimenopause.

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Try to limit refined carbohydrates such as bread, pasta, rice, pastries etc and eliminate sugar.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Try to follow an anti inflammatory Mediterranean style diet rich in colourful vegetables, healthy fats such as olives, avocado, olive oil, nuts and seeds, good quality protein and fatty fish. Try to limit refined carbohydrates such as bread, pasta, rice, pastries etc and eliminate sugar.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Borderline waist circumference and an increased waist to height ratio.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Try to follow an anti inflammatory Mediterranean style diet rich in colourful vegetables, healthy fats such as olives, avocado, olive oil, nuts and seeds, good quality protein and fatty fish. Try to limit refined carbohydrates such as bread, pasta, rice, pastries etc and eliminate sugar.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment

Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Overview Notes: Try to follow an anti inflammatory Mediterranean style diet rich in colourful vegetables, healthy fats such as olives, avocado, olive oil, nuts and seeds, good quality protein and fatty fish. Try to limit refined carbohydrates such as bread, pasta, rice, pastries etc and eliminate sugar.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Scar noted on right side of neck from parotid carcinoma resection. Keloid scars noted on chest.
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Scar noted on right side of neck from parotid carcinoma resection. Keloid scars noted on chest.

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Ideal waist circumference for women falls below 80 cm, above 80 cm increases your risk of chronic diseases. Father has had a stent inserted in his heart and mother is hypertensive.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Scar noted on right side of neck from parotid carcinoma resection. Keloid scars noted on chest.
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.

Overview Notes: Non smoker
Minimal alcohol consumption
Regular exercise
Mostly healthy diet
Comment Key: ClinicalExamRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Try to follow an anti inflammatory Mediterranean style diet rich in colourful vegetables, healthy fats such as olives, avocado, olive oil, nuts and seeds, good quality protein and fatty fish. Try to limit refined carbohydrates such as bread, pasta, rice, pastries etc and eliminate sugar.

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.

Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.

Overview Notes: Non smoker
Minimal alcohol consumption
Regular exercise
Mostly healthy diet
Comment Key: ClinicalExamRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Try to follow an anti inflammatory Mediterranean style diet rich in colourful vegetables, healthy fats such as olives, avocado, olive oil, nuts and seeds, good quality protein and fatty fish. Try to limit refined carbohydrates such as bread, pasta, rice, pastries etc and eliminate sugar.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Men's Health Recommendations:

Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.

Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------

Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Ideal waist circumference for women falls below 80 cm, above 80 cm increases your risk of chronic diseases. Father has had a stent inserted in his heart and mother is hypertensive.
Comment Key: EyesightNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Try to reduce your waist circumference by sticking to a healthy diet, decreasing stress and continuing with your exercise. If you are not managing consider seeing a dietician and possibly your gynae as you may be entering perimenopause.

Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Try to follow an anti inflammatory Mediterranean style diet rich in colourful vegetables, healthy fats such as olives, avocado, olive oil, nuts and seeds, good quality protein and fatty fish. Try to limit refined carbohydrates such as bread, pasta, rice, pastries etc and eliminate sugar.
Comment Key: EyesightNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Overview Notes: Ideal waist circumference for women falls below 80 cm, above 80 cm increases your risk of chronic diseases. Father has had a stent inserted in his heart and mother is hypertensive.
Comment Key: EyesightRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------

Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Try to follow an anti inflammatory Mediterranean style diet rich in colourful vegetables, healthy fats such as olives, avocado, olive oil, nuts and seeds, good quality protein and fatty fish. Try to limit refined carbohydrates such as bread, pasta, rice, pastries etc and eliminate sugar.

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.

Try to limit refined carbohydrates such as bread, pasta, rice, pastries etc and eliminate sugar.
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Microcytic & hypochromic red blood cells noted, possibly due to iron deficiency.
Suboptimal vitamin D levels.
hsCRP level indicating average risk of heart disease.
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.

Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Vitamin D level of 22ng/ml.
usCRP of 2.5mg/L.
Microcytic, hypochromic red blood cells.
Borderline waist circumference and an increased waist to height ratio.
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Microcytic & hypochromic red blood cells noted, possibly due to iron deficiency.
Suboptimal vitamin D levels.
hsCRP level indicating average risk of heart disease.
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------

Men's Health Recommendations:

Overview Notes: Ideal waist circumference for women falls below 80 cm, above 80 cm increases your risk of chronic diseases. Father has had a stent inserted in his heart and mother is hypertensive.

Suboptimal vitamin D levels.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Try to follow an anti inflammatory Mediterranean style diet rich in colourful vegetables, healthy fats such as olives, avocado, olive oil, nuts and seeds, good quality protein and fatty fish. Try to limit refined carbohydrates such as bread, pasta, rice, pastries etc and eliminate sugar.

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Microcytic & hypochromic red blood cells noted, possibly due to iron deficiency.
Suboptimal vitamin D levels.
hsCRP level indicating average risk of heart disease.
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Microcytic & hypochromic red blood cells noted, possibly due to iron deficiency.
Suboptimal vitamin D levels.
hsCRP level indicating average risk of heart disease.
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Try to reduce your waist circumference by sticking to a healthy diet, decreasing stress and continuing with your exercise. If you are not managing consider seeing a dietician and possibly your gynae as you may be entering perimenopause.

Comment Value: Microcytic & hypochromic red blood cells noted, possibly due to iron deficiency.
Suboptimal vitamin D levels.

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.
Comment Key: LabTestRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.
Comment Key: LabTestRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Try to reduce your waist circumference by sticking to a healthy diet, decreasing stress and continuing with your exercise. If you are not managing consider seeing a dietician and possibly your gynae as you may be entering perimenopause.
Comment Key: LabTestRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Vitamin D level of 22ng/ml.
usCRP of 2.5mg/L.
Microcytic, hypochromic red blood cells.
Borderline waist circumference and an increased waist to height ratio.
Comment Key: LabTestRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Try to reduce your waist circumference by sticking to a healthy diet, decreasing stress and continuing with your exercise. If you are not managing consider seeing a dietician and possibly your gynae as you may be entering perimenopause.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Try to follow an anti inflammatory Mediterranean style diet rich in colourful vegetables, healthy fats such as olives, avocado, olive oil, nuts and seeds, good quality protein and fatty fish. Try to limit refined carbohydrates such as bread, pasta, rice, pastries etc and eliminate sugar.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.

Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.
Comment Key: LifestyleRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Ideal waist circumference for women falls below 80 cm, above 80 cm increases your risk of chronic diseases. Father has had a stent inserted in his heart and mother is hypertensive.
Comment Key: LifestyleRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Try to follow an anti inflammatory Mediterranean style diet rich in colourful vegetables, healthy fats such as olives, avocado, olive oil, nuts and seeds, good quality protein and fatty fish. Try to limit refined carbohydrates such as bread, pasta, rice, pastries etc and eliminate sugar.

A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Vitamin D level of 22ng/ml.
usCRP of 2.5mg/L.
Microcytic, hypochromic red blood cells.
Borderline waist circumference and an increased waist to height ratio.
Comment Key: LifestyleRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.
Comment Key: LifestyleRecommendation
Comment Value: None

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Try to reduce your waist circumference by sticking to a healthy diet, decreasing stress and continuing with your exercise. If you are not managing consider seeing a dietician and possibly your gynae as you may be entering perimenopause.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: -Screen often for the conditions that have occurred in your family. Employ lifestyle habits that benefit & improve your present & future self.
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Try to follow an anti inflammatory Mediterranean style diet rich in colourful vegetables, healthy fats such as olives, avocado, olive oil, nuts and seeds, good quality protein and fatty fish. Try to limit refined carbohydrates such as bread, pasta, rice, pastries etc and eliminate sugar.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: -Screen often for the conditions that have occurred in your family. Employ lifestyle habits that benefit & improve your present & future self.

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: -Screen often for the conditions that have occurred in your family. Employ lifestyle habits that benefit & improve your present & future self.
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: -Screen often for the conditions that have occurred in your family. Employ lifestyle habits that benefit & improve your present & future self.
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Try to reduce your waist circumference by sticking to a healthy diet, decreasing stress and continuing with your exercise. If you are not managing consider seeing a dietician and possibly your gynae as you may be entering perimenopause.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: -Screen often for the conditions that have occurred in your family. Employ lifestyle habits that benefit & improve your present & future self.
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.

Minimal alcohol consumption
Regular exercise
Mostly healthy diet

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: -Screen often for the conditions that have occurred in your family. Employ lifestyle habits that benefit & improve your present & future self.
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Try to follow an anti inflammatory Mediterranean style diet rich in colourful vegetables, healthy fats such as olives, avocado, olive oil, nuts and seeds, good quality protein and fatty fish. Try to limit refined carbohydrates such as bread, pasta, rice, pastries etc and eliminate sugar.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: -Screen often for the conditions that have occurred in your family. Employ lifestyle habits that benefit & improve your present & future self.

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.

Minimal alcohol consumption
Regular exercise

Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.
Comment Key: MensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Try to reduce your waist circumference by sticking to a healthy diet, decreasing stress and continuing with your exercise. If you are not managing consider seeing a dietician and possibly your gynae as you may be entering perimenopause.
Comment Key: MensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.
Comment Key: MensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Try to follow an anti inflammatory Mediterranean style diet rich in colourful vegetables, healthy fats such as olives, avocado, olive oil, nuts and seeds, good quality protein and fatty fish. Try to limit refined carbohydrates such as bread, pasta, rice, pastries etc and eliminate sugar.

Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Try to follow an anti inflammatory Mediterranean style diet rich in colourful vegetables, healthy fats such as olives, avocado, olive oil, nuts and seeds, good quality protein and fatty fish. Try to limit refined carbohydrates such as bread, pasta, rice, pastries etc and eliminate sugar.

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.

Overview Notes: Try to reduce your waist circumference by sticking to a healthy diet, decreasing stress and continuing with your exercise. If you are not managing consider seeing a dietician and possibly your gynae as you may be entering perimenopause.

A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.

Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.
Comment Key: MensHealthRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.
Comment Key: MensHealthRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Try to reduce your waist circumference by sticking to a healthy diet, decreasing stress and continuing with your exercise. If you are not managing consider seeing a dietician and possibly your gynae as you may be entering perimenopause.
Comment Key: MensHealthRecommendation

Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.
Comment Key: MensHealthRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.
Comment Key: MentalHealthAnxietyRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------

Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.

Try to limit refined carbohydrates such as bread, pasta, rice, pastries etc and eliminate sugar.

usCRP of 2.5mg/L.
Microcytic, hypochromic red blood cells.
Borderline waist circumference and an increased waist to height ratio.
Comment Key: MentalHealthMoodRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.
Comment Key: MentalHealthMoodRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.

Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Ideal waist circumference for women falls below 80 cm, above 80 cm increases your risk of chronic diseases. Father has had a stent inserted in his heart and mother is hypertensive.
Comment Key: MentalHealthMoodRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.

Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.
Comment Key: MentalHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.
Comment Key: MentalHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: None
Comment Key: MentalHealthStressRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.
Comment Key: MentalHealthStressRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.
Comment Key: MentalHealthStressRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Vitamin D level of 22ng/ml.
usCRP of 2.5mg/L.
Microcytic, hypochromic red blood cells.
Borderline waist circumference and an increased waist to height ratio.

Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Non smoker
Minimal alcohol consumption
Regular exercise
Mostly healthy diet
Comment Key: ReportNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.
Comment Key: ReportNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Try to reduce your waist circumference by sticking to a healthy diet, decreasing stress and continuing with your exercise. If you are not managing consider seeing a dietician and possibly your gynae as you may be entering perimenopause.
Comment Key: ReportNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Try to follow an anti inflammatory Mediterranean style diet rich in colourful vegetables, healthy fats such as olives, avocado, olive oil, nuts and seeds, good quality protein and fatty fish. Try to limit refined carbohydrates such as bread, pasta, rice, pastries etc and eliminate sugar.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.
Comment Key: ReportNote

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.
Comment Key: ReportNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Small and pale red blood cells can be an indication of iron deficiency. You mention a history of iron deficiency and heavy periods. I recommend you do bloods to check your iron levels and then supplement with iron if necessary.
Comment Key: ReportNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Ideal waist circumference for women falls below 80 cm, above 80 cm increases your risk of chronic diseases. Father has had a stent inserted in his heart and mother is hypertensive.
Comment Key: ReportRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: usCRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. Yours is currently in the average risk range. A healthy diet, exercise and stress management all contribute to lowering inflammation in the diet. Supplements such as curcumin and omega 3 fish oil can help too.
Comment Key: ReportRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2019-10-29
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.
Comment Key: ReportRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Try to follow an anti inflammatory Mediterranean style diet rich in colourful vegetables, healthy fats such as olives, avocado, olive oil, nuts and seeds, good quality protein and fatty fish. Try to limit refined carbohydrates such as bread, pasta, rice, pastries etc and eliminate sugar.

Microcytic, hypochromic red blood cells.
Borderline waist circumference and an increased waist to height ratio.
Comment Key: ReportRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Low resting heart rate but normal sinus rhythm. Poor technique noted on lung function test making interpretation difficult but overall appears normal.
------------------------------
